title: Grenfell Tower report: Boris Johnson must take 'urgent action' over fire brigade’s flawed response, inquiry concludes
text:
Boris Johnson must take “urgent action” over London Fire Brigade’s flawed response to the Grenfell Tower tragedy, the official inquiry into the disaster has concluded.

Fewer people would have died had the fire service been better prepared to deal with the 2017 blaze, Sir Martin Moore-Bick finds in a damning 1,000 page report published today.

In an accompanying letter to the Prime Minister, Sir Martin says a series of official recommendations “require urgent action to be taken by the government and others who have responsibility and oversight and direction of the emergency services, in particular the London Fire Brigade."

“I look forward confidently to their implementation without delay," he adds.

The results of Sir Martin’s inquiry have already led to calls from victims and their families for London Fire Brigade chief Dany Cotton to step down immediately and surrender her £2m pension.
description: Boris Johnson must take “urgent action” over London Fire Brigade’s flawed response to the Grenfell Tower tragedy, the official inquiry into the disaster has concluded.
